TextBlock.Text: NESIA: Genetic testing has confirmed my previous suspicion; this node, unlike other nodes, is a distinctly different plant from the <color=purple>Bramble</color>. The only thing that remains unclear is how this could have occurred.
AZOLLA: Perhaps Karenia could shed light on its origin? She is the head druid of the Dree, so she may be capable of communicating with this node as well.

NESIA: I have tried to bring her here, but anytime she approaches this chamber she recoils and refuses to go nearer. On our first attempt I encouraged her to try and approach more and, after attempting to satisfy my request, she vomited, began spasming, and I was forced to drag her away.

AZOLLA: Goodness. Based on that, it seems to be of the utmost importance that we keep this plant far away from the Dree. Fortunately, the node seems to constantly be on the verge of starvation, so I highly doubt we will need to contend with any propagations from it.
SENNETTI: Could it simply be a random mutation? Perhaps even something with the strange propagation habits of the <color=purple>Bramble</color> needs to maintain the possibility of evolution.

NESIA: That is possible, though this would be quite a strange mutation. We are yet to see any nodes with significant mutations, and all others at least have genetic code indicating them to be of the same plant.
OKALIS: Perhaps this node did not originate from the <color=purple>Bramble</color> at all. Is it possible that a similar plant could have inserted a seed into this one?
NESIA: This is possible, but quite alarming. I struggle to imagine the sort of spatial anomalies that multiple plants like the <color=purple>Bramble</color> could cause.
